description: The concepts of normality, abnormality, and psychopathology; symptom syndromes;theory and research in psychopathology and psychotherapy.
name: ABNORMAL PSYCHOLOGY

values.comments: This course covered the concepts of normality, abnormality, and psychopathology, symptom syndromes, theory and research in psychopathology and psychotherapy.   Students found the material covered in the course as "interesting" and "engaging." But as interesting as the class may be, many found the course hindered by the professor.  One student in Professor Krause’s course claimed, "Krause is a very knowledgeable, nice, and kind instructor, though I don't think she does the best job capturing student interest." Students for the most part found "lecture not helpful for exams."   Students recommend "reading the textbook" in order to perform well on exams. Though there is not much work for the actual class, guest speakers do come in occasionally to talk about the chapter at hand.
